trial_identification.studytitle: Tracheal intubation using Clarus Video system in non-paralyzed patients with normal airway.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison of vocal cord exposure between paralyzed and non-paralyzed patients during tracheal intubation using Clarus video system

conditions.healthcondition: Patients scheduled for various surgical procedures requiring tracheal intubation as part of anaesthesia

interventions.interventions: Anaesthesia will be induced with target-controlled infusion of propofol 5 Âµg / ml and remifentanil 4 ng / ml, 2 min later, succinylcholine 1.5 mg / kg or comparable volume of saline will be injected according to the group of succinylcholine or saline. Participants in the succinylcholine group will receive one succinylcholine injection only. In both groups, after visual confirm of the vocal cord, saline or succinylcholine will be injected intravenously, while patients airway being suspended with Clarus and endo-tracheal tube will be passed into trachea. This procedure will take 5 minutes.
interventions.comparator: succinylcholine 1.5 mg / kg or comparable volume of saline will be injected in pre-filled syringes according to the group of succinylcholine or saline

primaryOutcome.outcome: visual confirmation of vocal cord through indirect vision of Clarus video system
primaryOutcome.timepoint: time at exposure of vocal cord

secondaryOutcome.outcome: success rate for intubation : confirmation through capnography
number of attempts for successful vocal cord exposure : through counting
number of optimization maneuver for vocal cord exposure; through counting
hemodynamics: systolic/diastolic blood pressure, heart rate monitoring via non-invasive method; automatic sphygmomanometer, echocardiogram (ECG).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: before, during the procedure, 1 and 5 min after intubation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: blood on the device, dental or lip injury, postoperative sore throat, hoarseness and dysphagia: visual observation, visual analogue scale.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: after the procedure, when patients discharging the recovery room

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: American society of anesthesiologists physical status (ASA) I or II
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: increased risk of pulmonary aspiration, cervical spine pathology, history of difficult tracheal intubation, ASA physical status = 3, thyromental distance < 5 cm, and Mallapati class > 4

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Jie Ae Kim, M.D., Ph.D., Associate professor in Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Samsung Medical Center, Sungkyunkwan University school of medicine, 50, Irwon-dong, Gangnam-gu, Seoul, Korea 135-710

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A new, optical video stylet, Clarus Video system, was evaluated for tracheal intubation in paralyzed and non-paralyzed patients with normal airway.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Samsung Medical Center, Sungkyunkwan University school of medicine, 50, Irwon-dong, Gangnam-gu, Seoul, Korea 135-710
